phrase: A coffee, please.
How much is it?
Can I get a decaf espresso?
Do you have almond milk?
One small coffee.
Coffee to go, please.
Do you have sugar?
Is this table free?
Where is the bathroom?
Do you have wifi?
Can I have a medium latte with soy milk, please?
Do you have any pastries?
I'd like a cappuccino with an extra shot, please.
What kind of teas do you have?
Can I get this heated up?
Is the wifi password on the receipt?
Do you have any gluten-free options?
How long will it take?
Can I pay by card?
What time do you close today?
I'd like to try your house blend as a pour-over.
Could you recommend something if I prefer less acidic coffee?
Can you make that with oat milk?
Do you offer any vegan pastries?
Is this coffee single-origin or a blend?
Could I get that with light ice, please?
Do you roast your own beans?
How would you describe the flavor profile of this blend?
I usually prefer medium roasts. What would you suggest?
Do you offer any seasonal specials?
I was wondering if you could tell me about your coffee sourcing practices?
Could you tell me more about your cold brew process?
How long do you typically roast your dark blend?
I've noticed your Ethiopian beans have a floral note to them. Is that typical for that region?
Would you say this coffee has more chocolate or fruity notes?
I'm curious about the environmental impact of your to-go cups. Are they compostable?
Do you adjust your brewing parameters seasonally as the beans age?
I'd be interested to know how you decide on your roast profiles for different origins.
Have you considered offering a coffee subscription service?
What water filtration system do you use for your espresso machine?
I'm particularly interested in single-origin beans.
I'm interested in trying a new blend. What do you recommend?
I've been experimenting with different brewing methods at home and find that my V60 brings out more acidity than my Chemex.
Would you mind sharing your thoughts on how altitude affects the flavor development in coffee beans?
I've noticed that washed processed coffees from Ethiopia tend to have a cleaner, more tea-like body compared to natural processed ones.
Have you found that the third wave coffee movement has influenced customer expectations regarding transparency in the supply chain?
I'm curious about your perspective on the correlation between price points and ethical sourcing in specialty coffee.
Do you find that certain varietals respond differently to various extraction methods?
I'd be interested to hear your thoughts on the debate between traditional Italian-style espresso and more modern, lighter roasted espresso approaches.
How do you balance acidity and sweetness when designing your espresso blends?
Would you mind elaborating on how the different processing methods affect the cup profile?
Can you explain the difference between a flat white and a latte?

I'm fascinated by the interplay between terroir and varietal expression in coffee; have you observed particular microclimates within the same region producing noticeably different flavor profiles in the same cultivar?
To what extent do you believe that innovations in fermentation techniques are redefining traditional notions of origin character in specialty coffee?
I've been contemplating the dichotomy between the scientific approach to extraction optimization and the more intuitive, sensory-driven methodology employed by many artisan roasters.

Would you consider the proliferation of refractometers and other precision tools to be indicative of a maturing industry, or perhaps reflective of an over-reliance on quantitative metrics at the expense of qualitative experience?
I'm curious whether you've observed any correlation between the structural complexity of certain flavor compounds in coffee and their persistence in long-term sensory memory.
Have you found that the discourse surrounding coffee quality has evolved beyond mere preference to encompass a more nuanced understanding of objective quality indicators?
To what extent do you believe that post-harvest processing innovations are democratizing quality potential across previously overlooked growing regions?
I find the intersection between coffee ritual and productivity culture to be a fascinating sociological phenomenon worthy of more critical examination.
